result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian D Siudak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 bail applied. Remaining balance to be paid while on supervision. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.
Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.
Defendant to submit to random testing.
Defendant must submit DNA sample.
Pay supervision fees.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian D Siudak

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brian D Siudak in court with attorney Christopher James Simonds.  Attorney Shannon Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.

Defendant Brian D Siudak in court with attorney Christopher James Simonds.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 09:45 am.
